intro: Waltheria communis var. gracilis, commonly known as slender waltheria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a distinctive central column. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
